knowledge: Angina Angina  Angina is a type of chest pain caused by reduced blood flow to the heart. It's a common symptom of coronary artery disease, which occurs when the arteries that supply blood to your heart become narrowed or blocked. There are several types of angina, including stable angina, unstable angina, and variant angina. Stable angina is the most common type and occurs during physical or emotional stress. Unstable angina is a medical emergency that requires prompt treatment. Variant angina is rare and occurs at rest. Treatment for angina may include lifestyle changes, medications, and medical procedures to improve blood flow to the heart.
